properties.declaration: @property (nonatomic, readonly, nullable) NSString *LYR_QUERYABLE_FROM ( LYRMessage LYR_QUERYABLE_FROM ( LYRConversation )
properties.comment: The userID of the authenticated user who sent the message.  Previously sentByUserID.
properties.discussion: The userID property is queryable via the LYRPredicateOperatorIsEqualTo and LYRPredicateOperatorIsNotEqualTo predicate operators.

class.comment: Returns a new instance of aggregate progress object.
class.name: aggregateProgressWithProgresses:

parameters.name: progresses
parameters.description: An array of {@link LYRProgress} instances.

instance.comment: progress An instance of {@link LYRProgress} to add to the aggregate.
instance.name: addProgress:

properties.comment: The app key.
properties.name: appID

properties.comment: Returns a {@link LYRIdentity} object specifying the user ID of the currently authenticated user or nil if the client is not authenticated.
properties.name: authenticatedUser
properties.discussion:
A client is considered authenticated if it has previously established identity via the submission of an identity token
and the token has not yet expired. The Layer server may at any time issue an authentication challenge and deauthenticate the client.

properties.comment: Configures the set of MIME Types for {@link LYRMessagePart} objects that will be automatically downloaded upon synchronization.
properties.name: autodownloadMIMETypes
properties.discussion: A value of nil indicates that all content is to be downloaded automatically and an empty NSSet indicates that no content should be. The default value is a set containing the MIME Type @"text/plain". Message parts belonging to latest messages will be auto-downloaded first.

properties.comment: Configures the maximum size (in bytes) for {@link LYRMessagePart} objects that will be automatically downloaded upon synchronization.
properties.name: autodownloadMaximumContentSize
properties.discussion: The default value is 0.

properties.comment: A Boolean value that determines whether or not the client will execute content transfers while the application is in a background state.
properties.name: backgroundContentTransferEnabled
properties.discussion: In order to utilize background transfers your application must implement the UIApplicateDelegate method application:handleEventsForBackgroundURLSession:completionHandler: and forward calls to the LYRClient method handleBackgroundContentTransfersForSessionWithIdentifier:completion:.> %note% > **Note:** Changes to this flag will not affect any transfers already in progress.

properties.comment: Returns the amount of disk space currently being utilized for the storage of downloaded message part content.
properties.name: currentDiskUtilization
properties.discussion:
> %note% > **Note:** The property is not updated in real-time, it may time some amount of time for it to update.Utilization may periodically peak above the configured diskCapacity while synchronization or downloads are in progress, but will be rebalanced once all operations
have completed.

properties.comment: The current session for the client.
properties.name: currentSession
properties.discussion: When a new LYRClient instance is initialized, it will check for an existing, persisted session. If a session exists, it will resume that session. If not, a new one will be created.

properties.comment: When YES, LayerKit will log detailed debugging information to both the XCode debugger and the file system.
properties.name: debuggingEnabled
properties.discussion: When debugging is enabled, all components will begin to synchronously log detailed information to both the file system and the debugger.

properties.comment: The object that acts as the delegate of the receiving client.
properties.name: delegate

properties.comment:
Specifies the maximum amount of disk space (in bytes) that may be utilized for storing downloaded message part content. A value of zero (the default) indicates that
an unlimited amount of disk space may be utilized.
properties.name: diskCapacity
properties.discussion:
Once current disk utilization of downloaded message part content exceeds the maximum capacity the system will delete content on a least recently used basis until
the total utilization is 80% of the configured disk capacity. Note that auto-downloaded content that gets deleted is not automatically downloaded again.

properties.comment: Returns a Boolean value that indicates if the client is connected to Layer.
properties.name: isConnected

properties.comment: Returns a Boolean value that indicates if the client is in the process of connecting to Layer.
properties.name: isConnecting

properties.comment: Returns the ordered set of {@link LYRPolicy} objects governing the behavior of the client.
properties.name: policies

properties.comment: The set of sessions that can be used with the client.
properties.name: sessions
properties.discussion: LYRClient instances can maintain multiple sessions at any given time. Each session is tied to a single, distinct, authenticated user.

properties.comment: The synchronization policy the client was initialized with.
properties.name: synchronizationPolicy

properties.comment: The synchronization policy options the client was initialized with.
properties.name: synchronizationPolicyOptions

classes.comment:
The LYRClient class and related classes provide an API for rich messaging via the Layer platform. This API supports the exchange of multi-part Messages within multi-user Conversations and advanced features such
as mutation of the participants, deletion of messages or the entire conversation, and the attachment of free-form user defined metadata. The API is sychronization based, fully supporting offline usage and providing full access
to the history of messages across devices.
classes.name: LYRClient

parameters.name: appID
parameters.description: An app id url obtained from the Layer Developer Portal. {@link https://developer.layer.com/projects}

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: Options to the client initialization. @see LYRClientOptionSynchronizationPolicy.

class.return: Returns a newly created Layer client object, or nil in the case the client cannot not be initialized due to file protection.
class.discussion:
> %warning% > **Warning:** Throws NSInternalInconsistencyException when creating another Layer Client instance with the same appID value under the same process (application).
However multiple instances of Layer Client with the same appID are allowed if running the code under Unit Tests.  Make sure to initialize the client when the
file access is available if the app uses NSFileProtection.
class.comment: Creates and returns a new Layer client instance.
class.name: clientWithAppID:options:

instance.comment: Adds the given policies to the receiver.
instance.name: addPolicies:error:
instance.return: A Boolean value that indicates if the given policies were added.

parameters.name: policies
parameters.description: The set of policies to be added to the client.

parameters.name: error
parameters.description: A pointer to an error that upon failure is set to an error object describing the policy could not be added.

parameters.name: identityToken
parameters.description:
A string object encoding a JSON Web Signature that asserts a set of claims about the identity of the client. Must be obtained from a remote identity
provider and include a nonce value that was previously obtained by a call to requestAuthenticationNonceWithCompletion: or via a server initiated authentication challenge.

parameters.name: completion
parameters.description:
A block to be called upon completion of the asynchronous request for authentication. The block takes two parameters: an {@link LYRIdentity} object with the remote user ID that
was authenticated (or nil if authentication was unsuccessful) and an error object that upon failure describes the nature of the failure.

instance.discussion:
Authenticating a Layer client requires the submission of an Identity Token from a remote backend application that has been designated to act as an
Identity Provider on behalf of your application. The Identity Token is a JSON Web Signature (JWS) string that encodes a cryptographically signed set of claims
about the identity of a Layer client. An Identity Token must be obtained from your provider via an application defined mechanism (most commonly a JSON over HTTP
request). Once an Identity Token has been obtained, it must be submitted to Layer via this method in ordr to authenticate the client and begin utilizing communication
services. If and identity token is submitted with a userID for which the client already has an authenticated session, that session will be resumed. Upon successful authentication, the client remains in an authenticated state until explicitly deauthenticated by a call to deauthenticateWithCompletion: or
via a server-issued authentication challenge.
instance.comment: Authenticates the client by submitting an Identity Token to Layer for evaluation.
instance.name: authenticateWithIdentityToken:completion:
instance.declaration: - (void)authenticateWithIdentityToken:(nonnull NSString *)identityToken completion:(nonnull void ( ^ ) ( LYRIdentity *_Nullable authenticatedUser , NSError *_Nullable error ))completion

instance.comment: Captures a debug snapshot of the current state of the Layer powered application and persists it to the file system.
instance.name: captureDebugSnapshotWithCompletion:
instance.discussion: The debug snapshot is a zip file containing the following: 1. A JSON dump of diagnostic information about the LYRClient 2. A copy of the local database, 3. A copy of any accumulated log files.

parameters.name: completion
parameters.description: A block to be called upon completion of the asynchronous request for a debug snapshot. The block takes one parameter: an NSURL location of the snapshot on the file system.

instance.comment: Signals the receiver to establish a network connection and initiate synchronization.
instance.name: connectWithCompletion:
instance.discussion: If the client has previously established an authenticated identity then the session is resumed and synchronization is activated.

parameters.name: completion
parameters.description:
An optional block to be executed once connection state is determined. The block has no return value and accepts two arguments: a Boolean value indicating if the connection was made
successfully and an error object that, upon failure, indicates the reason that connection was unsuccessful.

instance.declaration: - (void)countForQuery:(nonnull LYRQuery *)query completion:(nonnull void ( ^ ) ( NSUInteger count , NSError *_Nullable error ))completion
instance.comment: Executes the given query asynchronously and ppasses the result count and error back in a completion block.
instance.name: countForQuery:completion:

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The query to execute. Cannot be nil.

parameters.name: completion
parameters.description: The block that will be passed once Layer has executed the query.  If successful the count will have the count requested in the query, and if unsuccessful error will contain the specific query error.

instance.comment: Executes the given query and returns a count of the number of results.
instance.name: countForQuery:error:
instance.return: A count of the number of results or NSUIntegerMax if an error occurred.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The query to execute. Cannot be nil.

parameters.name: error
parameters.description: A pointer to an error that upon failure is set to an error object describing why execution failed.

instance.comment: Deauthenticates the client, disposing of any previously established user identity and disallowing access to the Layer communication services until a new identity is established. All existing messaging data is purged from the database.
instance.name: deauthenticateWithCompletion:

parameters.name: completion
parameters.description: A block to be executed when the deauthentication operation has completed. The block has no return value and has two arguments: a Boolean value indicating if deauthentication was successful and an error describing the failure if it was not.

instance.comment: Destoys an existing {@link LYRSession} object;
instance.name: destroySession:error:
instance.discussion: If a client is authenticated during a call to destroySession:error:, the client will immediately deauthenticate.

parameters.name: session
parameters.description: The session object that should be destroyed.

parameters.name: error
parameters.description: An error object describing a failure that has occured.

instance.comment: Signals the receiver to end the established network connection.
instance.name: disconnect

instance.declaration: - (void)executeQuery:(nonnull LYRQuery *)query completion:(nonnull void ( ^ ) ( NSOrderedSet<id<LYRQueryable> > *_Nullable resultSet , NSError *_Nullable error ))completion
instance.comment: Executes the given query asynchronously and passes the results back in a completion block.
instance.name: executeQuery:completion:

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The query to execute. Cannot be nil.

parameters.name: completion
parameters.description: The block that will be passed once Layer has executed the query.  If successful the resultSet will have the results, and if unsuccessful error will contain the specific query error.

instance.comment: Executes the given query and returns an ordered set of results.
instance.name: executeQuery:error:
instance.return: An ordered set of query results or nil if an error occurred.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The query to execute. Cannot be nil.

parameters.name: error
parameters.description: A pointer to an error that upon failure is set to an error object describing why execution failed.

parameters.name: userIDs
parameters.description: A set of userIDs to be followed.

parameters.name: error
parameters.description: A pointer to an error object that, upon failure, will be set to an error describing why the userIDs could not be followed.

instance.return: A Boolean value indicating if the operation of following userIDs was successful.
instance.discussion:
Successfully following a set of userIDs will post queryable {@link LYRIdentity} objects, with initial state followed equalling NO.  If any identity information
is available on the Layer platform it will be synchronized to the client when possible.
instance.comment: Follows a set of userIDs and creates local queryable identities.
instance.name: followUserIDs:error:

parameters.name: sessionIdentifier
parameters.description: URL session identifier handed by the application:handleEventsForBackgroundURLSession:completionHandler:.

parameters.name: completion
parameters.description: The block that will be called once Layer has successfully handled content transfers. It is your responsibility to call the UIApplication delegate method's completion handler. Note that this block is only called if the method returns YES.

instance.return: A Boolean value that indicates whether or not the client handled the content transfers for the given background session identifier. YES will be returned if the session identifier refers to a background session that was created by the Layer client, else NO.
instance.discussion: > %note% > **Note:** The receiver must be authenticated else a warning will be logged and NO will be returned. The completion is only invoked if the return value is YES.
instance.comment: Handles content transfer events from iOS and synchronizes the client if required.
instance.name: handleBackgroundContentTransfersForSession:completion:
instance.declaration: - (BOOL)handleBackgroundContentTransfersForSession:(nonnull NSString *)sessionIdentifier completion:(nonnull void ( ^ ) ( NSArray<LYRObjectChange*> *_Nullable changes , NSError *_Nullable error ))completion

instance.comment: Inserts the given policy in the receiver's policy set at the specified index.
instance.name: insertPolicy:atIndex:error:

parameters.name: policy
parameters.description: The policy to be added to the client.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: The index at which to insert the policy.

parameters.name: error
parameters.description: A pointer to an error that upon failure is set to an error object describing the policy could not be added.

parameters.name: messages
parameters.description: A set of messages to be marked as read or nil.

parameters.name: error
parameters.description: A pointer to an error object that, upon failure, will be set to an error describing why the message could not be sent.

instance.return: YES if the messages were marked as read or NO if the operation failed.
instance.discussion: The operation will ignore messages that have previously been marked as read.
instance.comment: Marks a set of messages as being read by the current user. If nil the operation will mark all unread messsages as being read by the current user.
instance.name: markMessagesAsRead:error:

parameters.name: participants
parameters.description: A set of participants with which to initialize the new Conversation.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: A dictionary of options to apply to the conversation.

parameters.name: error
parameters.description: A pointer to an error that upon failure is set to an error object describing why execution failed.

instance.return: The newly created Conversation or nil if an attempt is made to create a conversation with a distinct participants list, but one already exists. The existing conversation will be set as the value for the LYRExistingDistinctConversationKey in the userInfo dictionary of the error parameter.
instance.discussion: This method will create a new {@link LYRConversation} instance. Creating new message instances with a new {@link LYRConversation} object instance and sending them will also result in creation of a new conversation for other participants. An attempt to create a 1:1 conversation with a blocked participant will result in an error. If you wish to ensure that only one Conversation exists for a set of participants then set the value for the LYRConversationOptionsDistinctByParticipantsKey key to true in the options parameter.
instance.comment: Creates a new Conversation with the given set of participants.
instance.name: newConversationWithParticipants:options:error:

parameters.name: messageParts
parameters.description: An array of {@link LYRMessagePart} objects specifying the content of the message. Cannot be nil or empty.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: A dictionary of options to apply to the message.

instance.return:
A new message that is ready to be sent.
@raises NSInvalidArgumentException Raised if conversation is nil or messageParts is empty.
instance.discussion: This method will allow a maximum of 1000 parts per message.
instance.comment: Creates and returns a new message with the given set of message parts.
instance.name: newMessageWithParts:options:error:

instance.comment: Creates and returns a new {@link LYRSession} object with the supplied identifier;
instance.name: newSessionWithIdentifier:error:
instance.discussion: Applications can create an unlimited number of sessions. If a session already exists with the supplied identitifer, the method will return nil and the existing seesion can be found under the NSRecoveryAttempterErrorKey in the userInfo dictionary of the error.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: The identifier to be used for the session. If an identifier is not supplied, one will be created.

instance.comment: Creates and returns a new query controller with the given query.
instance.name: queryControllerWithQuery:error:
instance.return: A newly created query controller.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The query to create a controller with.

parameters.name: error
parameters.description: A pointer to an error that upon failure is set to a NSError object describing why query controller creation failed.

instance.comment: Removes the specified policies from the receiver.
instance.name: removePolicies:error:
instance.return: A Boolean value that indicates if the given policies were removed.

parameters.name: error
parameters.description: A pointer to an error that upon failure is set to an error object describing the policy could not be added.

parameters.name: policy
parameters.description: The set of polices to be removed from the client.

instance.comment: Requests an authentication nonce from Layer.
instance.name: requestAuthenticationNonceWithCompletion:
instance.discussion:
Authenticating a Layer client requires that an Identity Token be obtained from a remote backend application that has been designated to act as an
Identity Provider on behalf of your application. When requesting an Identity Token from a provider, you are required to provide a nonce value that will be included
in the cryptographically signed data that comprises the Identity Token. This method asynchronously requests such a nonce value from Layer.> %warning% > **Warning:** Nonce values can be issued by Layer at any time in the form of an authentication challenge. You must be prepared to handle server issued nonces as well as those
explicitly requested by a call to requestAuthenticationNonceWithCompletion:.

parameters.name: completion
parameters.description:
A block to be called upon completion of the asynchronous request for a nonce. The block takes two parameters: the nonce value that was obtained (or nil
in the case of failure) and an error object that upon failure describes the nature of the failure.

instance.comment: Configures the log level for the specified component
instance.name: setLogLevel:forComponent:

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: The log level to be set for the component.

parameters.name: component
parameters.description: The component to configure.

instance.comment: Informs the client that it should switch to the supplied session.
instance.name: switchToSession:error:
instance.discussion: If a client is connected and authenticated during a call to switchSession:error:, the client will immediately deauthenticate. If the client has previously been authenticated with the supplied session, the client will restore its authentication state.

parameters.name: session
parameters.description: The {@link LYRSession} instance the client should switch to.

parameters.name: error
parameters.description: An error object describing a failure that has occured.

parameters.name: userInfo
parameters.description: The user info dictionary received from the UIApplicaton delegate method application:didReceiveRemoteNotification:fetchCompletionHandler:'s userInfo parameter.

parameters.name: completion
parameters.description: The block that will be called once Layer has successfully downloaded new data associated with the userInfo dictionary passed in. It is your responsibility to call the UIApplication delegate method's fetch completion handler with an appropriate fetch result for the given objects. Note that this block is only called if the method returns YES.

instance.return: A Boolean value that determines whether the push was handled. Will be NO if this was not a push notification meant for Layer or if called while the application is active, and the completion block will not be called.
instance.discussion: The completion block will either return an error or one or both of the resulting objects depending on the information provided in the userInfo parameter.  In valid cases, just message is returned for an announcement payload, and both message and conversation for a message payload.> %note% > **Note:** The receiver must be authenticated else a warning will be logged and NO will be returned. The completion is only invoked if the return value is YES.
instance.comment: Inspects an incoming push notification and synchronizes the client if it was sent by Layer.
instance.name: synchronizeWithRemoteNotification:completion:
instance.declaration: - (BOOL)synchronizeWithRemoteNotification:(nonnull NSDictionary *)userInfo completion:(nonnull void ( ^ ) ( LYRConversation *_Nullable conversation , LYRMessage *_Nullable message , NSError *_Nullable error ))completion

parameters.name: userIDs
parameters.description: A set of userIDs to be unfollowed.

parameters.name: error
parameters.description: A pointer to an error object that, upon failure, will be set to an error describing why the userIDs could not be unfollowed.

instance.return: A Boolean value indicating if the operation of unfollowing userIDs was successful.
instance.discussion: userIDs that are conversation participants cannot be explicity unfollowed, and any attempt to do so will be ignored.
instance.comment: Unfollows a set of userIDs.
instance.name: unfollowUserIDs:error:

parameters.name: deviceToken
parameters.description: An NSData object containing the device token or nil.

parameters.name: error
parameters.description: A reference to an NSError object that will contain error information in case the action was not successful.

instance.return: A Boolean value that determines whether the action was successful.
instance.discussion: The device token is expected to be either an NSData object returned by the method application:didRegisterForRemoteNotificationsWithDeviceToken: or nil. If an NSData object is provided, the device token is cached locally and is sent to Layer cloud automatically when the connection is established. If nil, all device tokens that are associated with the currently authenticated and the current device will be deleted. Device tokens associated with other devices will not be deleted.
instance.comment: Tells the receiver to update the device token used to deliver Push Notifications to the current device via the Apple Push Notification Service.
instance.name: updateRemoteNotificationDeviceToken:error:

instance.comment: Validates the given policy to determine if it represents a valid configuration that can be added to the receiver.
instance.name: validatePolicy:error:
instance.return: A Boolean value that indicates if the given policy is valid or not.

parameters.name: policy
parameters.description: The policy to validate.

parameters.name: error
parameters.description: A pointer to an error that upon failure is set to an error object describing why validation was unsuccessful.

instance.declaration: - (void)waitForCreationOfObjectWithIdentifier:(nonnull NSURL *)objectIdentifier timeout:(NSTimeInterval)timeout completion:(nonnull void ( ^ ) ( id _Nullable object , NSError *_Nullable error ))completion
instance.comment: Waits for the creation of an object with the specified identifier and calls the completion block with the object if found or an error if it times out.
instance.name: waitForCreationOfObjectWithIdentifier:timeout:completion:

parameters.name: objectIdentifier
parameters.description: The identifier of the object expected to be created.

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: The specified time the method should wait for the object creation before timing out.

parameters.name: completion
parameters.description: The block that will be called once the operation completes with either the expected object or an error.

properties.comment: The compound predicate type for the receiver.
properties.name: compoundPredicateType

properties.comment: The receiver's subpredicates;
properties.name: subpredicates

class.name: compoundPredicateWithType:subpredicates:
class.return: A newly created compound predicate object.

properties.comment: A unique identifier assigned to every conversation by Layer.
properties.name: LYR_QUERYABLE_PROPERTY
properties.discussion: The identifier property is queryable via the LYRPredicateOperatorIsEqualTo, LYRPredicateOperatorIsNotEqualTo, LYRPredicateOperatorIsIn, and LYRPredicateOperatorIsNotIn operators.

properties.comment:
Returns a Boolean value that indicates if delivery receipts are enabled. When YES, clients will write delivery receipts and a delineation will be made between LYRRecipientStatusSent
and LYRRecipientStatusDelivered. When NO, messages will remain in the LYRRecipientStatusSent state until explicitly marked as read.
properties.name: deliveryReceiptsEnabled
properties.discussion:
When delivery receipts are enabled, client devices will acknowledge delivery of messages by writing a synchronized delivery receipt. This provides more granular message
status, but results in more synchronization activity. Developers are encouraged to disabled delivery receipts if the delivery status is unimportant or unused.

properties.comment: Returns a Boolean value that indicates if the receiver has been deleted.
properties.name: isDeleted

properties.comment: Property gives the total number of messages in the conversation, even in case when not all the messages have been synchronized with the client.
properties.name: totalNumberOfMessages

properties.comment: Property gives the total number of unread messages in the conversation, even in case when not all the messages have been synchronized with the client.
properties.name: totalNumberOfUnreadMessages

instance.comment: Adds participants to a given conversation.
instance.name: addParticipants:error:
instance.return: A Boolean value indicating if the operation of adding participants was successful.

parameters.name: participants
parameters.description: A set of providerUserID in a form of NSString objects.

parameters.name: error
parameters.description: A pointer to an error object that, upon failure, will be set to an error describing why the participants could not be added to the conversation.

parameters.name: error
parameters.description: A pointer to an error that upon failure is set to an error object describing why the deletion failed.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: The deletion mode, specifying how the message is to be deleted (i.e. for only the currently authenticated user' devices or synchronized across participants).

instance.return: A Boolean value indicating if the request to delete the conversation was submitted for synchronization.
instance.discussion: This method deletes a conversation and all associated messages for all current participants.
instance.comment: Deletes a conversation in the specified mode.
instance.name: delete:error:

instance.comment: Deletes a specific value by key path from the metadata dictionary.
instance.name: deleteValueForMetadataAtKeyPath:

parameters.name: keyPath
parameters.description: A key path into the metadata dictionary specifying the value to be deleted.

parameters.name: error
parameters.description: A pointer to an error that upon failure is set to an error object describing why the deletion failed.

instance.return: A Boolean value indicating if the request to leave the conversation was submitted for synchronization.
instance.discussion: This method removes the authenticated user from the conversation and deletes the conversation from all of their devices.A user can only leave a conversation if they are a current participant and the conversation has not been deleted.
instance.comment: Leaves the conversation.
instance.name: leave:

instance.comment: Marks all messages in the receiver as being read by the current user.
instance.name: markAllMessagesAsRead:
instance.return: YES if all unread messages were marked as read or NO if an error occurred.

parameters.name: error
parameters.description: A pointer to an error object that, upon failure, will be set to an error describing why the messages could not be marked as read.

instance.comment: Removes participants from a given conversation.
instance.name: removeParticipants:error:
instance.return: A Boolean value indicating if the operation of removing participants was successful.

parameters.name: participants
parameters.description: A set of providerUserID in a form of NSString objects.

parameters.name: error
parameters.description: A pointer to an error object that, upon failure, will be set to an error describing why the participants could not be removed from the conversation.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The message to be sent. Cannot be nil.

parameters.name: error
parameters.description: A pointer to an error object that, upon failure, will be set to an error describing why the message could not be sent.

instance.return:
A Boolean value indicating if the message passed validation and was enqueued for delivery.
@raises NSInvalidArgumentException Raised if message is nil.
instance.discussion:
The message is enqueued for delivery during the next synchronization after basic local validation of the message state is performed. Validation
that may be performed includes checking that the maximum number of participants has not been execeeded and that parts of the message do not have an aggregate
size in excess of the maximum for a message.
instance.comment: Sends the specified message.
instance.name: sendMessage:error:

instance.comment: Sends a typing indicator to the conversation.
instance.name: sendTypingIndicator:

parameters.name: typingIndicator
parameters.description: An {@link LYRTypingIndicator} value indicating the change in typing state to be sent.

instance.comment: Sets the value for the specified key path in the metadata dictionary.
instance.name: setValue:forMetadataAtKeyPath:

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The string or dictionary value to set for the given key path in the metadata.

parameters.name: keyPath
parameters.description: A key path into the metadata dictionary specifying where the value is to be set.

instance.comment: Sets multiple values on the metadata using an input dictionary, optionally merging with any existing values.
instance.name: setValuesForMetadataKeyPathsWithDictionary:merge:

parameters.name: metadata
parameters.description: A dictionary of metadata to assign or merge with the existing metadata.

parameters.name: merge
parameters.description: A Boolean flag that specifies whether the metadata is to be assigned directly or merged with any existing values.

instance.comment: Tells the client to synchronize all historic messages or all unread messages that haven't been synchronized with this client yet.
instance.name: synchronizeAllMessages:error:
instance.return: YES in case the request for the operation was successfull; otherwise NO.

parameters.name: messageSyncOption
parameters.description:
If used with LYRMessageSyncToFirstUnread, the client will try to only synchronize all messages up to the first unread message found in the conversation;
if LYRMessageSyncAll is passed, the client will load all historic messages in the conversation.

parameters.name: error
parameters.description: A pointer to an error object that, upon failure, will be set to an error describing why the synchronization process could not be performed.

instance.comment: Tells the client to synchronize more historic messages that are in the conversation.
instance.name: synchronizeMoreMessages:error:
instance.return: YES in case the request for the operation was successfull; otherwise NO.

parameters.name: minimumNumberOfMessages
parameters.description: The number of historic messages the client should try to fetch during synchronization; value should be greated than zero.

parameters.name: error
parameters.description: A pointer to an error object that, upon failure, will be set to an error describing why the synchronization process could not be performed.

properties.comment: The userID associated with the identity.
properties.discussion: The userID property is queryable via the LYRPredicateOperatorIsEqualTo, LYRPredicateOperatorIsNotEqualTo, LYRPredicateOperatorIsIn, and LYRPredicateOperatorIsNotIn operators.

properties.comment: A unique identifier for the identity.
properties.name: LYR_QUERYABLE_PROPERTY
properties.discussion: The identifier property is queryable via the LYRPredicateOperatorIsEqualTo, LYRPredicateOperatorIsNotEqualTo, LYRPredicateOperatorIsIn, and LYRPredicateOperatorIsNotIn operators.

properties.comment: The conversation that the receiver is a part of.
properties.discussion: The conversation property is queryable via the LYRPredicateOperatorIsEqualTo, LYRPredicateOperatorIsNotEqualTo, LYRPredicateOperatorIsIn, and LYRPredicateOperatorIsNotIn operators.

properties.comment: A unique identifier for the message.
properties.name: LYR_QUERYABLE_PROPERTY
properties.discussion: The identifier property is queryable via the LYRPredicateOperatorIsEqualTo, LYRPredicateOperatorIsNotEqualTo, LYRPredicateOperatorIsIn, and LYRPredicateOperatorIsNotIn operators.

properties.comment: Returns a Boolean value that indicates if the receiver has been deleted.
properties.name: isDeleted

properties.comment: An array of message parts (modeled by the {@link LYRMessagePart} class) that provide access to the content of the receiver.
properties.name: parts

properties.comment:
Returns a dictionary keyed the user ID of all participants in the Conversation that the receiver belongs to and whose
values are an NSNumber representation of the receipient status ({@link LYRRecipientStatus} value) for their corresponding key.
properties.name: recipientStatusByUserID

properties.comment: The sender who sent the message.
properties.name: sender
properties.discussion: The sender can be an authenticated user or from a platform, specificed by the sender's properties userID and name.  They are mutually exclusive.  Both properties are queryable from LYRMessage.

instance.comment: Deletes a message in the specified mode.
instance.name: delete:error:
instance.return:
A Boolean value indicating if the request to delete the message was submitted for synchronization.
@raises NSInvalidArgumentException Raised if message is nil.

parameters.name: error
parameters.description: A pointer to an error that upon failure is set to an error object describing why the deletion failed.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: The deletion mode, specifying how the message is to be deleted (i.e. for only the currently authenticated user's devices or synchronized across participants).

parameters.name: error
parameters.description: A pointer to an error object that, upon failure, will be set to an error describing why the message could not be sent.

instance.return: YES if the message was marked as read or NO if the message was already marked as read.
instance.discussion: If multiple messages must be marked as read, use markMessagesAsRead:error: on {@link LYRClient} or markAllMessagesAsRead:error on {@link LYRConversation} instead.
instance.comment: Marks the message as being read by the current user.
instance.name: markAsRead:

instance.comment: Retrieves the message state for a given participant in the conversation.
instance.name: recipientStatusForUserID:
instance.return: An {@link LYRRecipientStatus} value specifying the message status for the given participant or LYRRecipientStatusInvalid if the specified user is not a participant in the conversation.

parameters.name: userID
parameters.description: The user ID to retrieve the message status for.

properties.comment: The MIME Type of the content represented by the receiver.
A unique identifier for the message part.
properties.name: LYR_QUERYABLE_PROPERTY

properties.comment: The content of the receiver as a data object.
properties.name: data
properties.discussion: Property will be nil if content is not availble. Note that this operation might be expensive if trying to read large data.

properties.comment: Returns a NSURL object to the filesystem location of the receivers content or nil if the content is not available locally or was transmitted inline.
properties.name: fileURL
properties.discussion: Property will be nil if content is not availble.

properties.comment: Progress of the current transfer state.
properties.name: progress
properties.discussion: Property will return a new instance, if previous one has been released from the memory.

class.comment: Creates a message part with the given MIME Type and data.
class.name: messagePartWithMIMEType:data:
class.return:
A new message part with the given MIME Type and data.
@raises NSInvalidArgumentException Raised if MIME Type or data is nil.

parameters.name: MIMEType
parameters.description: A MIME Type identifying the type of data contained in the given data object.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The data to be embedded in the mesage part.

class.comment: Creates a message part with the given MIME Type and stream of data.
class.name: messagePartWithMIMEType:stream:
class.return:
A new message part with the given MIME Type and stream of data.
@raises NSInvalidArgumentException Raised if MIME Type or stream is nil.

parameters.name: MIMEType
parameters.description: A MIME Type identifying the type of data contained in the given data object.

parameters.name: stream
parameters.description: A stream from which to read the data for the message part.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The plain text body of the new message part.

class.return:
A new message part with the MIME Type text/plain and a UTF-8 encoded representation of the given input text.
@raises NSInvalidArgumentException Raised if text is nil.
class.comment: Create a message part with a string of text.
class.name: messagePartWithText:

instance.comment: Tells the receiver to schedule a download of the content, optionally reporting progress.
instance.name: downloadContent:
instance.return: An {@link LYRProgress} object that reports the progress of the download operation or nil if the content cannot be downloaded.

parameters.name: error
parameters.description: A pointer to an error object that upon failure will be set to an object that indicates why the download could not be started.

instance.comment: Returns a new input stream object for reading the content of the receiver as a stream.
instance.name: inputStream
instance.return: A new, unopened input stream object configured for reading the content of the part represented by the receiver, if the content is available, otherwise nil.

instance.comment: Tells the receiver to schedule a purge of the content, optionally reporting progress.
instance.name: purgeContent:
instance.return: An {@link LYRProgress} object that reports the progress of the content purging operation or nil if the content cannot be purged.

parameters.name: error
parameters.description: A pointer to an error object that upon failure will be set to an object that indicates why the content could not be purged.

properties.comment: The value of property after the update or nil if the receiver has a change type of LYRObjectChangeTypeCreate or LYRObjectChangeTypeDelete.
properties.name: afterValue

properties.comment: The value of property before the update or nil if the receiver has a change type of LYRObjectChangeTypeCreate or LYRObjectChangeTypeDelete.
properties.name: beforeValue

properties.comment: The object upon which the change has occured.
properties.name: object

properties.comment: The name of the property that was updated or nil if the receiver has a change type of LYRObjectChangeTypeCreate or LYRObjectChangeTypeDelete.
properties.name: property

properties.comment: The type of the change that has occured.
properties.name: type

properties.comment: Specifies the sender of the content that the policy applies to. If nil, the policy applies to all senders.
properties.name: sentByUserID

properties.comment: Returns the type of the receiver.
properties.name: type

classes.comment: It is important that you configure your LYRPolicy object appropriately before adding it to a client. Layer client objects make a copy of the policy you provide and use the copy for evaluation and enforcement. The policy objects maintained by the client are immutable and cannot be reconfigured. If you need to modify a policy, then you must make a copy of it, apply the appropriate changes, add the updated policy object to the client and remove the original policy (if appropriate).
classes.name: LYRPolicy

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of policy to create and return.

class.return: A newly created policy object with the given type.
class.discussion: Upon return, the policy will contain new constraints and as such will apply globally.
class.comment: Creates and returns a new policy with the given type.
class.name: policyWithType:

properties.comment: Returns the predicate operator that specifies how the property's value will be compared against the reference value.
properties.name: predicateOperator

properties.comment: Returns the property whose value the receiver will compare against the reference value.
properties.name: property

properties.comment: Returns the reference value used for comparison.
properties.name: value

class.name: predicateWithProperty:predicateOperator:value:

instance.comment: Cancels the current operation and its descendants (if cancellable).
instance.name: cancel

instance.comment: Pauses the current operation and its descendants (if cancellable).
instance.name: pause

classes.comment: > %warning% > **Warning:** Please note that when integrating an LYRProgress with a user interface you must take care to ensure that the updates are processed on the main thread. For performance reasons LYRProgress objects do not provide any guarantees about the thread context on which notifications will be delivered.
classes.name: LYRProgress

properties.comment: If specified, the system displays an alert that includes the Close and View buttons.
properties.name: actionLocalizationKey
properties.discussion: This property should only be set in a default configuration.  Setting this property in a per recipient configuration raises an exception.

properties.comment: A string that is the displayed text in the push notification.
properties.name: alert

properties.comment: An array of variable string values to appear in place of the format specifiers in loc-key.
properties.name: alertLocalizationArguments
properties.discussion: This property should only be set in a default configuration.  Setting this property in a per recipient configuration raises an exception.

properties.comment: A key to an alert-message string in a Localizable.strings file for the current localization.
properties.name: alertLocalizationKey
properties.discussion: This property should only be set in a default configuration.  Setting this property in a per recipient configuration raises an exception.

properties.comment: A dictionary with additional definable APNS values. Can include launch-image key.
properties.name: apns

properties.comment: A string that sets the APNS category for the push.
properties.name: category

properties.comment: A dictionary with optional additional text key-value pairs to be sent in the push notification.
properties.name: data

properties.comment: The name of a sound file in the app bundle.
properties.name: sound

properties.comment: A short string describing the purpose of the notification.
properties.name: title

properties.comment: Variable string values to appear in place of the format specifiers in title-loc-key.
properties.name: titleLocalizationArguments
properties.discussion: This property should only be set in a default configuration.  Setting this property in a per recipient configuration raises an exception.

properties.comment: The key to a title string in the Localizable.strings file for the current localization.
properties.name: titleLocalizationKey
properties.discussion: This property should only be set in a default configuration.  Setting this property in a per recipient configuration raises an exception.

instance.comment: Sets a per participant configuration for the specified participant identifier.
instance.name: setPushConfiguration:forParticipant:
instance.discussion:
This method is used on a default configuration to add per participant customization.  If this method is called on an instance that has per
participant configurations, an exception is raised.

parameters.name: configuration
parameters.description: A LYRPushNotificationConfiguration instance with values that override the default configuration.

parameters.name: participantIdentifier
parameters.description: A string that represents the participant identifier that will receive customized configuration.

properties.comment: The limit configures the maximum number of objects to be returned when the query is executed.
properties.name: limit
properties.discussion: A value of NSUIntegerMax (the default) indicates that no limit should be applied.

properties.comment: The offset configures the number of rows that are to be skipped in the result set before results are returned.
properties.name: offset
properties.discussion: The default value is zero. The offset isn't used if the limit is not defined.

properties.comment: The predicate of the receiver.
properties.name: predicate

properties.comment: Returns the queryable class that the receiver is bound to.
properties.name: queryableClass

properties.comment: Configures how results are returned when the receiver is executed.
properties.name: resultType
properties.discussion: The default is LYRQueryResultTypeObjects.

properties.comment: Configures the sort descriptors used to order the result set.
properties.name: sortDescriptors
properties.discussion:
The sort descriptors specify how the objects returned when the query is executed should be ordered (for example by creation date or index). The sort descriptors are
applied in the order in which they appear in the sortDescriptors array. A value of nil (the default) means that no explicit sorting is applied and the results are returned in database row order.

classes.comment:
Instances of LYRQuery are used to query the local database for messaging content. Queries target a specific queryable class
and apply a predicate that constrains the search. Predicates are expressed in terms of a public property (such as createdAt or isUnread), an operator
(such as 'is equal to' or 'is greater than or equal to'), and a comparison value. The sort order of the results can be affected by applying one or more
sort descriptors which also bind to a public property and are applied in either ascending or descending order. To facilitate pagination, queries may be further
constrained by applying a limit and offset value. Query results can be returned as either fully realized object instances, object identifiers, or as an aggregate
count of the total number of objects matching the query.
classes.name: LYRQuery

class.comment: Creates and returns a new query object for the given queryable class.
class.name: queryWithQueryableClass:

parameters.name: queryableClass
parameters.description: A class that conforms to the {@link LYRQueryable} protocol that is to be queried.

properties.comment: Accesses the receiver's delegate.
properties.name: delegate

properties.comment:
Configures a pagination window for limiting the number of objects that are exposed to the UITableView or UICollectionView object driven via the query controller.
The default value is NSIntegerMax, which indicates that no pagination window is to be applied.
properties.name: paginationWindow
properties.discussion:
The pagination window is used to improve the performance of table or collection view objects that utilize a query controller as the model for their associated data source.
When a pagination window is applied, the query controller will expose a subset of the total set of objects that match the query to the consumer. The window is expressed as a signed integer,
where a positive value indicates a window that originates from index 0 (or the "top" of the data set) and covers the specified number of objects. In other words, given a query that matches
100 objects, a pagination window of 25 would display objects from index 0 to 24. Additional objects can be paged into the view on demand by expanding the window size. The pagination window can
also be expressed as a negative integer, in which case the window originates from the maximum index of the object collection (or the "bottom" of the data set) and extends backward. In the example
of a collection of 100 objects, a pagination window of -25 would display the objects from index 74 to 99. Negative pagination windows are useful when displaying a paginated collection of messages
where the most recent messages are displayed on the bottom of the view and the chronologically older messages are displayed at the top.

As the user scrolls to the top or taps a "Load More" button, the window can be expanded to performantly load additional messages into the collection. The pagination window can expand as objects are added to the result set due to incoming events.

properties.comment: Returns the query of the receiver.
properties.name: query

properties.comment: Returns the total number of objects in the query result set without pagination.
properties.name: totalNumberOfObjects
properties.return: The number of objects in the result set, without pagination constraints.

properties.comment: Configures the set of properties on the queried model class for which LYRQueryControllerChangeTypeUpdate changes will be emitted. The default value is nil, which means that all property changes will generate update notifications to the delegate.
properties.name: updatableProperties
properties.discussion: The set of updatable properties is used to enhance performance by suppressing the delivery of uninteresting update notifications to the delegate and the subsequent reloading of table or collection view cells. For example, given a collection view that is rendering {@link LYRMessage} objects but does not include read or delivery receipt status on the cell, the developer may wish to limit the updatable properties to isSent and isUnread so that the UI does not refresh as delivery and read receipts are synchronized from other participants of the conversation. A value of nil indicates that no filtering is to be applied and any update to an object in the collection will generate an update callback. An empty set disables all update notifications.

instance.comment: Returns the total number of objects in the result set.
instance.name: count
instance.return: The number of objects in the result set that the controller has loaded based on paginationWindow.

instance.comment: Executes the query and loads a result set into the receiver.
instance.name: execute:
instance.return: A Boolean value that indicates if execution of the query was successful.

parameters.name: error
parameters.description:
A pointer to an error object that upon failure is set to an error object that describes
the nature of the failure.

instance.comment: Executes the query asynchronously and loads a result and error in a completion block.
instance.name: executeWithCompletion:

parameters.name: completion
parameters.description:
A block that passes back a BOOL if the execution of the query was successful, and an associated error object if there
was an error during execution.

instance.comment: Returns the index path for the given object in the result set.
instance.name: indexPathForObject:
instance.return: The index path for the given object or nil if it does not exist in the result set.

parameters.name: object
parameters.description: The object to retrieve the index path for.

instance.comment:
Returns a dictionary mapping the given set of object identifiers to the NSIndexPath values that indicate
where in the query controller's result set the corresponding objects appear. Any object identifiers that are not in
the result set (or are outside the pagination window) will not have an entry in the dictionary returned.
instance.name: indexPathsForObjectsWithIdentifiers:
instance.return: A dictionary mapping the object identifiers that are part of the query controller results to the index path that appear at.

parameters.name: objectIdentifiers
parameters.description: The set of object identifiers to look up within the query controller.

instance.comment: Returns the number of objects in the given section in the result set.
instance.name: numberOfObjectsInSection:
instance.return: The number of objects in the specified section of the result set.

parameters.name: section
parameters.description: The section to return the number of objects for.

instance.comment: Returns the number of sections in the result set.
instance.name: numberOfSections
instance.return: The number of sections in the receiver's result set.

instance.comment: Returns the object for the given index path from the result set.
instance.name: objectAtIndexPath:
instance.return: The object at the specified index or nil if none could be found.

parameters.name: indexPath
parameters.description: The index path for the object to retrieve.

properties.comment: The authenticated user for the session.
properties.name: authenticatedUser

properties.comment: The database path for the underlying database for the session.
properties.name: databasePath

properties.comment: The identifier for the session.
properties.name: identifier

properties.comment: The path to which the session is persisted.
properties.name: sessionPath

properties.comment: An enum value that describes the authentication state of the session.
properties.name: state

instance.comment: Tells the delegate that a client has successfully authenticated with Layer.
instance.name: layerClient:didAuthenticateAsUserID:

parameters.name: client
parameters.description: The client that has authenticated successfully.

parameters.name: userID
parameters.description:
The user identifier in Identity Provider from which the Identity Token was obtained. Typically the primary key, username, or email
    of the user that was authenticated.

instance.comment: Tells the delegate that an operation encountered an error during a local mutation or synchronization activity.
instance.name: layerClient:didFailOperationWithError:

parameters.name: client
parameters.description: The client that failed the operation.

parameters.name: error
parameters.description: An error describing the nature of the operation failure.

instance.comment: Tells the delegate that a content transfer has finished.
instance.name: layerClient:didFinishContentTransfer:ofObject:

parameters.name: client
parameters.description: The client that will begin the content transfer.

parameters.name: contentTransferType
parameters.description: Type enum representing the content transfer type.

parameters.name: object
parameters.description: Object whose content did finish transfering.

instance.comment: Informs the delegate that the client has lost an established connection with Layer due to an error.
instance.name: layerClient:didLoseConnectionWithError:

parameters.name: client
parameters.description: The client that lost the connection.

parameters.name: error
parameters.description: The error that occurred.

instance.comment: Tells the delegate that the server has issued an authentication challenge to the client and a new Identity Token must be submitted.
instance.name: layerClient:didReceiveAuthenticationChallengeWithNonce:
instance.discussion:
At any time during the lifecycle of a Layer client session the server may issue an authentication challenge and require that
the client confirm its identity. When such a challenge is encountered, the client will immediately become deauthenticated and will no
longer be able to interact with communication services until reauthenticated. The nonce value issued with the challenge must be submitted
to the remote identity provider in order to obtain a new Identity Token.

parameters.name: client
parameters.description: The client that received the authentication challenge.

parameters.name: nonce
parameters.description: The nonce value associated with the challenge.

instance.comment: Tells the delegate that objects associated with the client have changed due to local mutation or synchronization activities.
instance.name: layerClient:objectsDidChange:

parameters.name: client
parameters.description: The client that received the changes.

parameters.name: changes
parameters.description: An array of {@link LYRObjectChange} objects, each one describing a change.

instance.comment: Informs the delegate that the client is making an attempt to connect to Layer.
instance.name: layerClient:willAttemptToConnect:afterDelay:maximumNumberOfAttempts:

parameters.name: client
parameters.description: The client attempting the connection.

parameters.name: attemptNumber
parameters.description: The current attempt (of the attempt limit) that is being made.

parameters.name: delayInterval
parameters.description: The delay, if any, before the attempt will actually be made.

parameters.name: attemptLimit
parameters.description: The total number of attempts that will be made before the client gives up.

instance.comment: Tells the delegate that a content transfer will begin.
instance.name: layerClient:willBeginContentTransfer:ofObject:withProgress:

parameters.name: client
parameters.description: The client that will begin the content transfer.

parameters.name: contentTransferType
parameters.description: Type enum representing the content transfer type.

parameters.name: object
parameters.description: Object whose content will begin transfering.

parameters.name: progress
parameters.description: The {@link LYRProgress} instance that tracks the progress of the object.

instance.comment: Informs the delegate that the client has successfully connected to Layer.
instance.name: layerClientDidConnect:

parameters.name: client
parameters.description: The client that made the connection.

instance.comment: Tells the delegate that a client has been deauthenticated.
instance.name: layerClientDidDeauthenticate:
instance.discussion: The client may become deauthenticated either by an explicit call to deauthenticateWithCompletion: or by encountering an authentication challenge.

parameters.name: client
parameters.description: The client that was deauthenticated.

instance.comment: Informs the delegate that the client has disconnected from Layer.
instance.name: layerClientDidDisconnect:

parameters.name: client
parameters.description: The client that has disconnected.

instance.comment: Tells the delegate that the progress instance has changed.
instance.name: progressDidChange:
instance.discussion: Progress is observed via instance's fractionCompleted or completedUnitCount properties.

instance.declaration: - (void)queryController:(nonnull LYRQueryController *)controller didChangeObject:(nonnull id)object atIndexPath:(nullable NSIndexPath *)indexPath forChangeType:(LYRQueryControllerChangeType)type newIndexPath:(nullable NSIndexPath *)newIndexPath
instance.comment: Tells the delegate that a particular object in the result set of query controller has changed.
instance.name: queryController:didChangeObject:atIndexPath:forChangeType:newIndexPath:

parameters.name: object

parameters.name: indexPath
parameters.description: The index path of the object or nil if the change is an insert.

parameters.name: type

parameters.name: newIndexPath
parameters.description: The new index path for the object or nil if the change is an update or delete.

parameters.name: The
parameters.description: query controller that is changing.

instance.comment: Tells the delegate that the result set of query controller has changed.
instance.name: queryControllerDidChangeContent:

parameters.name: The
parameters.description: query controller that has changed.

instance.comment: Tells the delegate that the result set of query controller is about to change.
instance.name: queryControllerWillChangeContent:

parameters.name: The
parameters.description: query controller that is changing.

properties.comment: Returns the unique identifier for the receiver as a URL.
properties.name: identifier

values.name: LYRClientSynchronizationPolicyCompleteHistory
values.comment: Client will perform the synchronization process by fetching the complete history for all conversations, using this sync policy.

values.name: LYRClientSynchronizationPolicyUnreadOnly
values.comment:
Client will perform the synchronization process by fetching all the messages up to first unread message in for each conversation.
     If all messages in a conversations have been marked as read, the client will fetch the last (most recent) message in the conversation in the initial sync.

values.name: LYRClientSynchronizationPolicyMessageCount
values.comment:
Client will perform the synchronization process by fetching last few recent messages -- count is defined with the LYRClientOptionSynchronizationMessageCount key
     that needs to be passed along in the options dictionary of the client initializer.

values.name: LYRCompoundPredicateTypeAnd
values.comment: A logical AND compound predicate type.

values.name: LYRCompoundPredicateTypeOr
values.comment: A logical OR compound predicate type.

values.name: LYRCompoundPredicateTypeNot
values.comment: A logical NOT compound predicate type.

values.name: LYRContentTransferAwaitingUpload
values.comment: Content is available locally and is yet to be uploaded.

values.name: LYRContentTransferUploading
values.comment: Content is available locally and is in a state of uploading.

values.name: LYRContentTransferReadyForDownload
values.comment: Content is not available locally but it is ready for download.

values.name: LYRContentTransferDownloading
values.comment: Content is not yet avaiable locally and is in a state of downloading.

values.name: LYRContentTransferComplete
values.comment: This state is expected when the transfer completes.

values.name: LYRContentTransferTypeDownload
values.comment: The {@link LYRContentTransferType} values describe the type of a transfer. Used when {@link LYRClient} calls to the delegate via layerClient:willBeginContentTransfer:ofObject:withProgress and layerClient:didFinishContentTransfer:ofObject: methods.

values.name: LYRContentTransferTypeUpload
values.comment: The {@link LYRContentTransferType} values describe the type of a transfer. Used when {@link LYRClient} calls to the delegate via layerClient:willBeginContentTransfer:ofObject:withProgress and layerClient:didFinishContentTransfer:ofObject: methods.

values.name: LYRDeletionModeMyDevices
values.comment:
Content is deleted for only the currently authenticated user. The deletion will also be synchronized 
     among all other devices for the current user.

values.name: LYRDeletionModeAllParticipants
values.comment:
Content is deleted from all devices of all participants. This is a synchronized, permanent delete
     that results in content being deleted from the devices of existing users who have previously synchronized and
     makes the content unavailable for synchronization to new participants or devices.
     *

values.name: LYRMessageSyncAll
values.comment:
Using this option with [conversation synchronizeAllMessages:error:] method will
     tell the client to synchronize all messages for that conversation.

values.name: LYRMessageSyncToFirstUnread
values.comment:
Using this option with [conversation synchronizeAllMessages:error:] method will
     tell the client to synchronize all messages up to the first unread mesasge in that conversation.

values.name: LYRPolicyTypeBlock
values.comment: Defines a policy which will block a matching entity from communicating with the target.

values.name: LYRPredicateOperatorIsEqualTo
values.comment: The property's value is equal to the given value.

values.name: LYRPredicateOperatorIsNotEqualTo
values.comment: The property's value is not equal to the given value.

values.name: LYRPredicateOperatorIsLessThan
values.comment: The property's value is less than the given value.

values.name: LYRPredicateOperatorIsLessThanOrEqualTo
values.comment: The property's value is less than or equal to the given value.

values.name: LYRPredicateOperatorIsGreaterThan
values.comment: The property's value is greater than the given value.

values.name: LYRPredicateOperatorIsGreaterThanOrEqualTo
values.comment: The property's value is greater than or equal to the given value.

values.name: LYRPredicateOperatorIsIn
values.comment: The property's value is contained in the given collection of values.

values.name: LYRPredicateOperatorIsNotIn
values.comment: The property's value is not contained in the given collection of values.

values.name: LYRPredicateOperatorLike
values.comment: The property's value partial string matches the given value.

values.name: LYRQueryControllerChangeTypeInsert
values.comment: An object is being inserted into the result set.

values.name: LYRQueryControllerChangeTypeDelete
values.comment: An object is being deleted from the result set.

values.name: LYRQueryControllerChangeTypeMove
values.comment: An object is being moved within the result set.

values.name: LYRQueryControllerChangeTypeUpdate
values.comment: An object in the result set has changed state.

values.name: LYRQueryErrorUnqueryableProperty
values.comment: Codes for errors in the LYRQueryingErrorDomain error domain.

values.name: LYRQueryErrorUnsupportedPredicate
values.comment: Codes for errors in the LYRQueryingErrorDomain error domain.

values.name: LYRQueryErrorUnsupportedSortDescriptor
values.comment: Codes for errors in the LYRQueryingErrorDomain error domain.

values.name: LYRQueryResultTypeObjects
values.comment: The query is to return fully realized object instances.

values.name: LYRQueryResultTypeIdentifiers
values.comment: The query is to return object identifier URL objects.

values.name: LYRQueryResultTypeCount
values.comment: The query is to return a count of the number of results it would return if executed.

values.name: LYRRecipientStatusInvalid
values.comment: Status for the recipient cannot be determined because the message is not in a state in which recipient status can be evaluated or the user is not a participant in the Conversation.

values.name: LYRRecipientStatusPending
values.comment: The message has been transported to Layer and is awaiting synchronization by the recipient's devices.

values.name: LYRRecipientStatusSent
values.comment: The message has been transported to Layer and is awaiting synchronization by the recipient's devices.

values.name: LYRRecipientStatusDelivered
values.comment: The message has been synchronized to at least one device for a recipient but has not been marked as read.

values.name: LYRRecipientStatusRead
values.comment: The message has been marked as read by one of the recipient's devices.

values.name: LYRTypingDidBegin
values.comment: The {@link LYRTypingIndicator} enumeration describes the states of a typing status of a participant in a conversation.

values.name: LYRTypingDidPause
values.comment: The {@link LYRTypingIndicator} enumeration describes the states of a typing status of a participant in a conversation.

values.name: LYRTypingDidFinish
values.comment: The {@link LYRTypingIndicator} enumeration describes the states of a typing status of a participant in a conversation.
